titleInfo.title: "A View of Col. Johnson's Engagement with the Savages (commanded by Tecumseh) near the Moravian Town, October 5th, 1812 [sic]"

subject.topic: U.S. Army campaigns of the War of 1812

mods.abstract: Hand-colored woodcut depicts Colonel Richard Mentor Johnson defending himself against an Indian chief, American infantrymen firing on the enemy, a dismounted soldier engaging an Indian in hand-to-hand combat, a savage in the act of scalping a wounded drummer, cavalry pursuing retreating savages, and Tecumseh rallying his men. Prominent features are numbered. N.B. The word "savage" is used several times in the original illustration caption. N. Dearborn, engraver.
